plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

109166.name: SupaFastPages
109166.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

•Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
•Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
•Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

•Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays “Select an Option” and is disabled. When the user selects either “Sections” or “Frames,” the text changes to “Convert,” and the button becomes enabled.
•Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

•Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When “Sections” or “Frames” is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
•Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

•Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

plugins.name: ICONCINO - Free icons
plugins.description:
These icons were designed by Gabriele Malaspina and are released under the CC0 1.0 license.


You can use them freely for personal and commercial projects, with no attribution required.


Modify them, remix them, use them in client work or side projects — no strings attached.


All icons are available in a single Figma file to make browsing and copying super easy (using the file you can customize the corner radii).


If you find them useful and want to say thanks, you can buy me a coffee ☕ — totally optional, but always appreciated!

accepted.name: Gabriele Malaspina
accepted.description: Digital product designer ❖ Figma educator ❖ Coordinator of the UI Design Course by Politecnico di Milano ❖ Design systems enthusiast ❖ Accessibility advocate

plugins.name: Pixel Painter for Figma
plugins.description:
✨ What is Pixel Painter?

Bored in Figma? Need a quick brain break between design reviews? Pixel Painter lets you unleash your inner 8-bit artist right inside Figma — one pixel at a time. Think pixel art meets coffee break.


🎮 How It Works

  1. Fire up the plugin, get a random fun drawing challenge (like “Draw a cat in 1 minute” 😺).
  2. Use the color palette to fill a pixel grid — no judgment on your MS Paint skills.
  3. Timer keeps the pressure on — can you beat the clock?
  4. Save your masterpiece as PNG (complete with a cheeky watermark).


🧠 Why It Rocks

  1. 100+ non-repeating prompts keep the creativity flowing
  2. Click-to-color grid, color palette, and timer — like Figma meets Mario Paint
  3. Works inside the plugin popup — no canvas mess
  4. Great for solo play
plugins.tagline: Take a break and draw Pixels.

Perfect for cleaning up unused styles and optimizing your design system.

plugins.name: Variable Length Lorem Ipsum
plugins.description:
Most text generator plugins let you specify a single number for the word count. However, sometimes you want to specify a range instead, to introduce variability, and create more realistic results (realistic for lorem ipsum text, that is)


Features:

  1. Generates lorem ipsum text with the option of varied lengths.
  2. Enter a single number (e.g., "10") for fixed word count or a range (e.g., "5-10") for random variation within limits.
  3. Optionally add punctuation for generated text (default: off).
  4. Optionally auto-close the plugin after generating text (default: off).
  5. Supports your system setting for light or dark mode.
plugins.tagline: Specify a range of lengths for your lorem ipsum text

137731.description:

  2. Enter a single number (e.g., "10") for fixed word count or a range (e.g., "5-10") for random variation within limits.
  3. Optionally add punctuation for generated text (default: off).
  4. Optionally auto-close the plugin after generating text (default: off).
  5. Supports your system setting for light or dark mode.
137731.release_notes: Fixed an issue where selected text nodes would change their resizing method when the text changed.
137731.tagline: Specify a range of lengths for your lorem ipsum text

plugins.name: Figma to BlocksIn System
plugins.description:
The BlocksIn System plugin for Figma is a game-changer for front-end development. Effortlessly convert Figma designs into React components, ready for implementation with our NPM package.


BlocksIn System - React Component Library


Here's how it simplifies your workflow:


  • Design: Create patterns using Figma components.
  • Generate: Select a frame and click 'Generate' to convert it into React markup.
  • Implement: Seamlessly integrate the code with BlocksIn System React components.
  • Reuse: Streamline your process by reusing design patterns.


Watch the video here.


Special thanks to my friend Eugenio who inspired this project. Check out his amazing work.


Get started with the BlocksIn System plugin and revolutionise your design-to-development process!
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into React BlocksIn System components effortlessly.

plugins.name: SpeX - Design to Code by AI
plugins.description:
SpeX – Design to Code by AI


Transform your Figma components into AI-readable specs for seamless design-to-code automation.


🔍 What is SpeX?

SpeX bridges design and development by exporting structured specifications from Figma—enabling AI tools like Cursor and GitHub Copilot to generate accurate, production-grade UI code that aligns with your actual components.


🎯 Who It's For

  1. Design system teams scaling reusable components
  2. Developers using AI coding assistants
  3. Product teams aiming for consistent handoffs
  4. Organizations enforcing structured design workflows


🚀 Key Capabilities


📋 AI-Ready Export

  1. Export to YAML/JSON with full style tokens
  2. Support nested components, variants, and instances
  3. Auto-detect and optimize SVG icons
  4. Generate component preview thumbnails


🔧 Fine-Tuning Metadata

  1. Add codeComponent and codeFilePath
  2. Auto-fill metadata via pattern recognition
  3. Visual tree browser with search and bulk editing


🗃 Component Record Management

  1. Full CRUD for structured records
  2. Sync from Notion, APIs, or JSON files
  3. Filterable views with fallback thumbnails
  4. Export component registry as JSON


🤖 Real-Time AI Integration

  1. WebSocket-based MCP bridge for tools like Cursor AI
  2. Real-time dashboard and analytics
  3. Serve specs, manifest, and previews on-demand
  4. Auto-reconnect and error resilience


🧭 How It Works

  1. Select Components – from your Figma file
  2. Fine-Tune – add mappings to your codebase (optional)
  3. Export or Connect – structured file export or live MCP server
  4. Generate Code – AI tools use the specs to write code that aligns with your system


📁 Output Structure (Simplified)

export-[timestamp]/
├── screen.yaml # Main screen specs
├── manifest.yaml # File manifest
├── components/ # Component specs
├── styles/ # Design token definitions
├── icons/ # SVG exports
├── previews/ # PNG previews


Example screen.yaml

# screen.yaml
screen:
id: "signup-screen-001"
name: "SignupForm"
type: "FRAME"

dimensions:
width: 375
height: 812

styleRefs:
fills:
- "@styles/fills#background-default"
typography:
- "@styles/typography#body-normal"

children:
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#username-field-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#email-field-002"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#password-field-003"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/Button#signup-button-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextLink#login-link-001"


This defines a form-based screen layout with multiple input fields, a button, and a link—referencing reusable components in the design system.


🔗 spex-mcp

Install the companion server to integrate with AI dev tools:

→ spex-mcp on npm


💡 Why SpeX?


For Designers

  1. Reduce handoff friction
  2. Track design usage across implementations


For Developers

  1. Avoid guesswork, get exact specs
  2. Leverage AI tools with full context


For AI Tools

  1. Access structured, hierarchical data
  2. Align generated code with real-world components


SpeX is where design systems meet automation. Your components. Your rules. Real code.
plugins.tagline: Built on your real components, not generic templates.

plugins.name: Material Design Icons (MDI)
plugins.description:
Access to thousands of Material Design Icons — Instantly elevate your design workflow with a complete, up-to-date library of Material Design Icons, right inside Figma!


🎨 Fully customizable – Change size, color, and stroke directly within Figma to match your project’s style effortlessly.


🔍 Powerful search – Find exactly the icon you need in seconds with intelligent keyword-based filtering.


🧩 Organized categories – Browse icons by category (e.g., navigation, social, UI elements) for faster discovery and inspiration.


⚡ One-click insert – Drop icons into your design with a single click—no need to leave Figma or download external assets.


🛠️ Perfect for UI/UX designers – Maintain design consistency and follow Google’s Material Design guidelines with pixel-perfect icons.


🌐 Always up to date – Get the latest MDI icons automatically—no manual updates required.


✨ Whether you're designing apps, websites, or dashboards, the MDI Library plugin gives you everything you need to work smarter and design faster.

accepted.name: sadik sajid
accepted.description: Hi, I'm sadik sajid — a passionate designer crafting intuitive and visually engaging digital experiences. I specialize in user interfaces, design systems

plugins.name: Variable Calculator
plugins.description:
Easily calculate variable values

Use Variable Calculator to apply math formulas, recalculating your variables. Apply to en entire collection, specific group, or specific mode. Great for scaling numbers for responsive behavior.


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Enter the formula to apply to the variables
  5. Calculate!


Tip

  1. Use a, b, c, n, v, x, $ or value to reference the current variable value.
  2. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  3. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  4. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Run math operations on your variable values!

133341.name: Variable Calculator
133341.description:
Easily calculate variable values

Use Variable Calculator to apply math formulas, recalculating your variables. Apply to en entire collection, specific group, or specific mode. Great for scaling numbers for responsive behavior.


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Enter the formula to apply to the variables
  5. Calculate!


Tip

  1. Use a, b, c, n, v, x, $ or value to reference the current variable value.
  2. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  3. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  4. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.
133341.tagline: Run math operations on your variable values!

plugins.name: State Machines
plugins.description:
Create state machines and integrate them directly into your designs.


What is a state machine?


Think of a state machine as a way to organize all the different "states" your design can be in. For example, a form might have states like "empty," "filled," "submitting," or "error." State machines help you clearly define these states and the rules for moving between them, making complex interactions more manageable.


---


This plugin is experimental. Contributions and feature requests welcome: github.com/colebemis/figma-state-machines

accepted.name: Cole Bemis
accepted.description: Building things for people who build things. R&D at GitHub Next

plugins.name: Layer Formatter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Layer Formatter, a powerful tool that simplifies layer renaming. Whether you need hyphens, underscores, camel case, or kebab case, this tool ensures your layers align perfectly with coding conventions.


Say goodbye to messy names and hello to clean, developer-friendly files. Perfect for effortless handoff and collaboration!


✨ Key Features ✨


  1. Auto-Space Conversion: Automatically replace spaces in layer names with underscores (_) or remove them entirely for clean, code-friendly naming.
  2. Batch Rename Layers: Rename multiple layers in seconds, saving time and improving efficiency.
  3. Flexible Naming Styles: Supports hyphens, underscores, camel case, kebab case, and more to fit your coding standards.
  4. Instant Updates: Apply changes with a single click—no need for tedious manual edits.
  5. Streamlined Handoff: Deliver developer-ready files with consistent, clean layer names for seamless collaboration.
plugins.tagline: Rename layers for seamless developer handoff

plugins.name: VariableMaster - Swap Variables
plugins.description:
VariableMaster - Master all your variable workflows


Variable Master is your complete variable workflow solution for Figma. Switch variables between any libraries - local to published, published to local, or between different files. Whether you're swapping collections within the same file or moving components from one library to another, Variable Master makes it simple and fast.


Features :


- Swap variables between local and published libraries

- Switch collections between local variables

- Switch component variables from library A to library B easily

- Work with current selection, page, or entire file

- See what will change before you apply it

- Handle thousands of variables at once

- Pick which collections to swap or exclude specific variables


How to use :


1. Choose what to update (selection, page, or file) and pick your libraries from the drop down.

2. Select which collections to swap and see the preview.

3. Uncheck variables you don't want to change, then click on swap variables.


Ps : plugin picks libraries only if they are added in the File. You can add them to you file via Asset panel.


RoadMap :


- Find all variables used in your designs

- Export and import variable collections

- Check for design elements that need variables​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​


This Plugin is completely free to use, No charges for swapping variables.
plugins.tagline: Master all your variable workflows

138841.description:

Variable Master is your complete variable workflow solution for Figma. Switch variables between any libraries - local to published, published to local, or between different files. Whether you're swapping collections within the same file or moving components from one library to another, Variable Master makes it simple and fast.

- Swap variables between local and published libraries

- Switch collections between local variables

- Switch component variables from library A to library B easily

- Work with current selection, page, or entire file

- See what will change before you apply it

- Pick which collections to swap or exclude specific variables


How to use :

3. Uncheck variables you don't want to change, then click on swap variables.


Ps : plugin picks libraries only if they are added in the File. You can add them to you file via Asset panel.

- Export and import variable collections

- Check for design elements that need variables​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​


This Plugin is completely free to use, No charges for swapping variables.

plugins.name: DeepL Translator
plugins.description:
DeepL Translator


A Figma plugin that quickly translates text within frames using the DeepL API.

The acceleration feature enables faster translations and cost savings.


Features


  1. 🚀 Fast Translation: Re-use past translation history for fast translation (Acceleration Feature)
  2. 💰️ Cost Saving: Save API Usage by Re-use past translation history (Acceleration Feature)
  3. 🌐 Multi-language Support: Supports 29 languages
  4. 📚 Glossary Support: Use DeepL glossaries for consistent translations
  5. 🌍 Auto Detection: Automatic source language detection
  6. 📝 Non-destructive: Creates new frames for translations while preserving originals
  7. 🎯 Simple Operation: Just select languages and click translate


How to Use


  1. Get a DeepL API key (see below)
  2. Select a frame containing text to translate
  3. Choose source and target languages
  4. (Optional) Select a glossary
  5. Click "Translate"
  6. Translation results appear in a new frame


Getting a DeepL API Key


1. Sign up for a DeepL API account at DeepL.

  1. Free plan available (500,000 characters/month)
  2. Pro plan available for more usage

2. Get your API key:

  1. Log in to your DeepL account
  2. Go to "Account" → "API keys"
  3. Copy your API key

3. Enter your API key in the plugin settings


Glossary


You can set up glossary on DeepL Web Console.

https://support.deepl.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021634540-About-the-glossary

https://www.deepl.com/ja/glossary?sortColumn=name&sortDirection=asc


Please let me know via feedback form if you have a good reason to edit the Glossary on the Plugin directly.


Supported Languages


See the complete list of supported languages for details.


Major languages include:


  1. English (EN)
  2. Chinese (ZH)
  3. Korean (KO)
  4. German (DE)
  5. French (FR)
  6. Spanish (ES)
  7. Italian (IT)
  8. Dutch (NL)
  9. Japanese (JA)
  10. Portuguese (PT)
  11. Russian (RU)


And 18 more languages


Notes


  1. DeepL API key required (available with free plan)
  2. Free plan includes 500,000 characters per month
  3. Source language must be specified when using glossaries
  4. API keys are securely encrypted and stored


Support & Feedback


We welcome your feedback! Please contact to developer through:


- Contact Form for:

  1. Questions & Inquiries
  2. Feature Requests
  3. Bug Reports
  4. General Feedback


Privacy

  1. DeepL API keys are securely encrypted
  2. Translation data is processed on DeepL servers and not stored on this plugin server.
plugins.tagline: Translate texts in Figma by DeepL

plugins.name: Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless
plugins.description:
Figma variables to Penpot tokens by Detachless

This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design system variables and Penpot's design tokens, allowing seamless migration of your local variables.


How It Works

The plugin connects to Figma's Variables API to extract local variable collections and transform them into Penpot's token format. Here's the process:


  1. Collection Discovery: Upon launch, the plugin scans your Figma file for all variable collections and presents them in a selectable list.
  2. Intelligent Mapping: The converter handles various Figma variable types (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) and maps them to Penpot's token system, including:
  3. Variable mode conversion to Penpot themes
  4. Proper handling of variable references
  5. Special formatting of colors (HEX and RGBA)
  6. Nested structure preservation
  7. Token Organization: The plugin creates a structured Penpot token JSON with:
  8. Themes based on your variable collections and modes
  9. Proper metadata for Penpot compatibility
  10. Dependency management between collections
  11. Clean Output: The result is a downloadable JSON file ready to be imported into Penpot's design system.


Something is not working or you have suggestion for new feature? Submit feedback


🎉 Bonus: Publish your designs directly to websites with Detachless – no coding needed! 💻🌐

accepted.name: Detachless
accepted.description: Publish website directly from Figma to web or export your Figma designs as code ✨

accepted.name: Lazar Krstić
accepted.description: Building Detachless, a tool that helps you to publish your website directly from Figma to web.

plugins.tagline: Unlock cross-platform design: Convert Figma variables to Penpot tokens instantly.

plugins.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
plugins.description:
✨ Figma Plugin Description

Practice real-world design challenges directly inside Figma.

Sharpen your product thinking and UX skills with guided prompts and exercises — perfect for designers prepping for interviews or just looking to stay sharp.


🌐 What is Designus?

When you submit your solution via the plugin, your work gets published to the Designus platform — where you can explore other designers' answers and learn from diverse approaches.

Use the plugin to focus on solving the challenge, and head to the website to review and reflect on submitted solutions.


🛠 How to Use the Plugin

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Choose a challenge from the calendar
  3. Click Import to add the challenge & solution frame to your canvas
  4. Design your solution directly inside Figma
  5. Reopen the plugin and go to Export Solution
  6. Select your solution frame and write a short description
  7. Click Export to submit your answer
  8. Go to Designus website to review your submission and check out others' solutions.
plugins.tagline: Design Challenges - Level up your design skills through real design challenges.

131471.name: Big-Tech Style Design Challenges
131471.description:

plugins.name: RePic
plugins.description:
Smart Bulk Image Replacement for Figma

Boost your design workflow with bulk image replacement. Effortlessly swap images into your Figma projects with just a few clicks—select your target images, pick replacements, and let RePic handle the rest. Perfect for updating mockups, prototypes, or templates, RePic auto-fills extra slots with a transparent placeholder and offers a "delete after replace" option for a clutter-free canvas.


How to Use RePic

  1. Select images (or their frame) to replace.
  2. Select replacement images next.
  3. Click Replace Images—done!

Optional: Check "Delete after use"
plugins.tagline: Lightning-Fast Bulk Image Replacement

plugins.name: Text Paster
plugins.description:
What it does

This plugin allows you to:

  1. Select text layers from a selection
  2. Copy text strings from multiple text layers
  3. Paste text strings into multiple text layers in batch
  4. Sort text strings


How to use it

Transfer texts between frame

  1. Select a frame that contain text layers
  2. Click Copy in the plugin
  3. Select another frame that contain text layers you want to transfer the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Transfer text from Spreadsheet

  1. Copy text from a spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel, etc.) or any line-break-separated text.
  2. Paste it into the text box in plugin
  3. Select a frame that contain text layers you want to paste the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Delete hidden layers

  1. Select a frame
  2. Click Select "Hidden layer" (from dropdown menu)
  3. Press Delete key to delete hidden layers


-------

Kudos to AI — This plugin is the result of vibe coding with Cursor and GitHub Copilot. All the features were built just to scratch my own itches.
plugins.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

131151.release_notes:
- Fixed the issues that Copy and Paste buttons cannot handle directly selected text layers (previously can only select from frames)
- Improve progress bar perceived performance issue by reducing progress bar update frequency. Update progress UI every 1000 layers (previous 100). It sacrifices progress bar accuracy for better peformance
131151.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

plugins.name: Convert To Bionic Writing
plugins.description:
Unlock Faster, More Focused Reading with Bionic Reading: This plugin applies the Bionic Reading method (bionic-reading.com) to your text layers, dynamically bolding the initial letters of words to improve reading speed and comprehension. By leveraging the natural fixation points of the eye, Bionic Reading helps readers process text more efficiently with less cognitive effort. This plugin works best with fonts that offer multiple weight variations.


Key Features:


  1. Converts selected text layers to Bionic Reading format.
  2. Optimizes text for faster and more focused reading.
  3. Ideal for improving readability and engagement.



Open Source: github.com/mrayubmuhammad/Convert-To-Bionic-Writing-Figma-Plugin



Created by d3flow (www.d3flow.com) using Claude.ai.

Note: Requires fonts with multiple weight options for optimal performance.

accepted.name: Ayub Muhammad
accepted.description: Cofounder at d3flow where we Design, Develop and Distribute in flow.

accepted.name: d3flow
accepted.description: Design, Develop, Distribute in flow with d3flow

plugins.tagline: Focused Reading, Better Typography

plugins.name: CopyMate - Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting
plugins.description:
Streamline your copywriting process without leaving Figma. CopyMate helps designers and writers enhance, translate, and refine UX copy in seconds while maintaining clarity, brand tone, and design consistency.


Enhance your copywriting ✍️

Improve writing quality with AI-powered suggestions that:

- Align with brand guidelines

- Improve clarity and readability

- Preserve original capitalization


Shorten Text Without Losing Meaning ✂️

Make text more concise while keeping intent and usability intact—perfect for button labels, tooltips, and UI elements.


Translate Text Instantly 🌍

Convert selected text into multiple languages while preserving formatting.


How CopyMate works

1. Select one or more text layers

2. Run CopyMate from the Figma plugin menu

3. Choose an action: Translate, Enhance, Shorten, or Quality Check

4. Review & Apply your changes instantly


Try CopyMate now and supercharge your copywriting workflow! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting

129506.name: CopyMate - Smarter, Faster, Better Copywriting
129506.description:
Streamline your copywriting process without leaving Figma. CopyMate helps designers and writers enhance, translate, and refine UX copy in seconds while maintaining clarity, brand tone, and design consistency.


Enhance your copywriting ✍️

Improve writing quality with AI-powered suggestions that:

- Align with brand guidelines

- Improve clarity and readability

- Preserve original capitalization


Shorten Text Without Losing Meaning ✂️

Make text more concise while keeping intent and usability intact—perfect for button labels, tooltips, and UI elements.


Translate Text Instantly 🌍

Convert selected text into multiple languages while preserving formatting.


How CopyMate works

1. Select one or more text layers

2. Run CopyMate from the Figma plugin menu

3. Choose an action: Translate, Enhance, Shorten, or Quality Check

4. Review & Apply your changes instantly


Try CopyMate now and supercharge your copywriting workflow! 🚀

plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

Technical details:

  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

plugins.name: Top'n'Fix
plugins.description:
Tired of constantly switching to the prototype panel to fix a layer or frame? With the Top'n'Fix plugin, you can easily bind it to the shortcut combination of shift+opt+cmd+] and accomplish it with a single click, saving you time and effort.

Key Features:

  1. Streamlined Fixing: Instantly fix any layer or frame without the need to navigate to the prototype panel.
  2. Efficient Shortcut: Assign the shift+opt+cmd+] shortcut to quickly apply fixes with a single keystroke.


Please note that at least one object should already be fixed on the screen, fixed area in layers must be created. Hope to fix it in next version.
plugins.tagline: Fix layer, bring to the front and fix, fix frame, fix in the prototype

58977.name: Top'n'Fix
58977.description:

plugins.name: Freaking Fake Data
plugins.description:
About plugin:

Freaking Fake Data simplifies your design workflow in Figma, FigJam and Slides by letting you fill mockups with custom, project-specific data instead of random content. Take control of your text layers, create tailored datasets and unify data formats for your design team — perfect for consistent names, phone numbers or other details. Working locally, it boosts productivity and eliminates errors while speeding up mockup creation.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Mockup Filling: Quickly populate text layers with your data.
  2. Unified Team Data: Import a CSV or JSON file for team consistency.
  3. Bulk Text Magic: Mass-apply text to layers with one click.
  4. Cross-Platform Support: Works in Figma, FigJam and Slides.
  5. Easy Data Import: Upload CSV or JSON files instantly.
  6. Default Data Option: Test with preloaded samples (e.g., names, cities).


How to Use:

  1. Import Data: Create a table in a tool like Google Sheets or Excel, fill it with data, export as CSV or JSON, and upload—or use default data. Import multiple files and switch via tabs.
  2. Select Text Layers: Highlight the text layers to apply data to.
  3. Apply Data: Pick a column (e.g., "First Name") and apply data. Choose order:
  4. Sort: Inserts data in table order.
  5. Random: Inserts data in random order.
  6. Explore Options: Switch tabs, view rows, or use "Set as Default" to save a tab for next launch.


How to Create a Table:

  1. Enter data in columns (e.g., "First Name" in one, "City" in another); the first row becomes button names.
  2. Add separators by leaving a column empty with "---" or "- - -" in the header for a line or use "//Special Offers" or "// Special Offers" for a labeled group divider. (example: telegram)


Perfect for prototypes, presentations or team projects — try it now!
plugins.tagline: Fill Mockups Quickly — use unified data for your design team. Massively paste your text into Figma

plugins.name: 단순노무
plugins.description:
사용방법: https://youtu.be/gdHHHRS4cxk


선택한 프레임을 기반으로 여러 프레임을 빠르게 복제하고, 표 형식 데이터를 사용하여 각 프레임의 이름과 내부 텍스트 레이어 내용을 자동으로 채워주는 플러그인입니다. 스프레드시트나 마크다운 테이블 데이터를 붙여넣어 한 번에 입력하고, 복제된 프레임을 원하는 개수만큼 가로로 정렬하여 그리드 형태로 배치할 수 있습니다. 반복적인 콘텐츠 생성 및 관리 작업을 효율적으로 처리하세요.
plugins.tagline: 복붙은 이제그만~ 한 번에 하세요
